description.narrative: Children are protected from HIV infection and free from AIDS, which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: WCAR country programmes contribute to achieving the Strategic Plan 2014-2017 key results for children through application of country appropriate strategies - in development and humanitarian contexts

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children are protected from HIV infection and free from AIDS

description.narrative: At mid-year, WCAR is sustaining progress towards the children and AIDS targets despite many challenges related to decreasing global funding toward HIV/AIDS. The UNICEF office is actively support countries to mobilize other resources, including domestic ressources to fill the gaps. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2017

title.narrative: Countries with at least 50% coverage of antiretroviral treatment (ART) among eligible children and adolescent (disaggregated by gender)
of countries with at least 80% of ANC settings offering ARVs -> of countries in which at least 80% of all pregnant women attending ANC services are tested for HIV
of countries with equity-informed decentralized eMTCT plans being implemented.
of countries in which 80% of all pregnant women living with HIV are reached with triple drug ARV regimens
of Countries with at least a 50% coverage in condom use at last sexual encounter among adolescents aged 15-19 years reporting multiple partners in last year (disaggregated by gender)
of countries with adolescents and HIV plans/strategies informed by the investment framework being implemented
of countries with HIV-sensitive social protection and child protection systems and policies in place
% of emergency countries that include/implement HIV as part of their humanitarian/emergency response
